sentence.text: Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) is commonly associated with obesity, muscle organ development 2 diabetes, and/or hypertriglyceridemia, while alcoholic steatohepatitis (ASH) is associated with alcohol abuse.
Both NASH and ASH patients can develop cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) if left untreated.
